node.title: Erebus Memorial: Contractors begin work after protest disruption
node.description: Progress on the memorial was stalled earlier this year after protesters camped out Auckland's Sir Dove-Myer Robinson Park.

node.title: Rapid antigen testing: What you need to know
node.description: Explainer - The Ministry of Health is considering further rollout of rapid antigen tests to the general public. Here's what you need to know about the current rules and what experts have to say. Audio

node.title: Mt Ruapehu crater lake heats up, small earthquakes expected
node.description: GNS Science says small volcanic earthquakes can be expected a Mt Ruapehu as the Crater Lake goes through a new heating phase.

node.title: 'I probably wouldn't have been fighting for my life in ICU if I had been vaccinated'
node.description: A Hamilton mum, who says she was a Covid-19 denier until she got the virus, is finally back home after ending up in hospital. Audio

node.title: Covid-19 booster shot: Investigation after person injected with used needle
node.description: The Canterbury DHB is investigating after a person was injected with a used needle when getting a booster shot of the vaccine.

node.title: Healthcare workers reject DHB pay offer
node.description: Allied, public health, scientific and technical healthcare workers have turned down the latest pay offer from district health boards.

node.title: Porirua housing project to provide 880 new homes, Ngati Toa iwi prioritised
node.description: The first funding deal for the Government's Infrastructure Acceleration Fund has been signed between Kāinga Ora, Porirua City Council and Te Rūnanga o Toa Rangatira, which will see 880 houses built in…

node.title: Charles R. Morris, Iconoclastic Author on Economics, Dies at 82
node.description: Resisting ideological labels, experienced in government and banking, he critiqued policymakers’ “good intentions” and the costs of health care and forecast the 2008 financial crisis.

node.title: Massachusetts joins other states in distributing free at-home tests.
node.description: Massachusetts secured more than two million rapid at-home tests that would be delivered to 102 towns with high poverty rates.

node.title: Jan. 6 Committee Recommends Contempt Charge for Meadows
node.description: The panel sent a criminal contempt of Congress referral to the full House, as the extent of Mark Meadows’s role in President Donald J. Trump’s efforts to overturn the election became clearer.

node.title: Jail Officer Who Led Others to Safety Is Among the 74 Killed in Tornadoes
node.description: Families were mourning in several states after a swarm of tornadoes left a trail of destruction. “It’s almost crushing how it feels,” said Kentucky’s governor, Andy Beshear.

node.title: Amtrak Worker Sold Railroad Equipment for Years to Line His Pockets, U.S. Says
node.description: Jose Rodriquez, 49, of Brick, N.J., pleaded guilty to mail fraud on Monday. Prosecutors said he obtained 114 chain saws for the railroad service, but sold them for profit.

node.title: 'Crazy Frog' Twitter Account Reports Getting Death Threats Over Upcoming NFT
node.description: Critics have accused Crazy Frog of cashing in on a online fad and have asked why anyone would purchase the NFT when you can get it online for free.

node.title: Harvard Study Finds Lower Vehicle Emissions Cut Deaths by the Thousands, But More Work Ahead
node.description: Researchers recorded that fewer carbon emissions emitting from vehicles correlated with fewer deaths.

node.title: Booted Soap Star Ingo Rademacher Partners With RFK Jr. to Sue ABC Over Vaccine Mandate
node.description: Ingo Rademacher's lawsuit reportedly suggests that ABC had political motivations for requiring employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

node.title: Kin of Victims in Marjory Stoneman School Shooting Allowed to Be Heard in Court
node.description: The judge agreed with prosecutors that said statements will be written in advance and given to Nikolas Cruz's attorneys before parents read them to the jury.

node.title: Car Marooned in Niagara River, Which Led to Rescue, Comes Loose and Goes Over the Falls
node.description: The car, which a woman's body was rescued from last Wednesday, appears to have gone over the falls Saturday night amid heavy winds and rising water in a storm.

node.title: Jan. 6 Committee Reveals Texts From Mark Meadows, Votes to Move Forward With Charges
node.description: The House committee voted unanimously Monday to move forward with contempt charges against Meadows after he declined to appear for a deposition last week.

node.title: Biden Makes Last-Ditch Effort to Get Manchin on Board to Pass Spending Bill Before Christmas
node.description: The president stated that the two had "a nice conversation" about the various aspects of the bill.

node.title: Sydney woman allegedly scammed $1 million from prospective Canberra home buyer
node.description: A 29-year-old Sydney woman faces court over an alleged property scam that fleeced $1 million from a Canberra woman.

node.title: AdBlue 'price gouging' won't be solved easily, says haulage company
node.description: A national milk haulage company says an extra two weeks' supply of AdBlue from Indonesia won't solve "price gauging" being experienced in Australia for the scarce diesel exhaust fluid.

node.title: Donald Trump's former chief of staff held in criminal contempt of US Congress
node.description: A US congressional committee investigating the January 6 attack on the Capitol votes unanimously to hold Donald Trump's former chief of staff Mark Meadows in criminal contempt of Congress.

node.title: Christmas is coming, but two looming threats could be catastrophic for the economy — and our health
node.description: As we inch closer to Christmas, two big threats are looming large across the globe: Inflation, and the Omicron variant. Both could have potentially catastrophic consequences for the economy and our wellbeing, writes David Taylor.

node.title: Manawatū emergency teams check flooding aftermath as rain eases
node.description: Emergency services worked through the night after a deluge of rain flooded parts of the Manawatū region. Audio

node.title: Māngere sends strong message on light rail: 'This is for us'
node.description: The government will be announcing the route and preferred mode for its long-promised Auckland light rail plans in the next two weeks. But will the affected South Auckland communities be along for the…

node.title: Covid-19: Iwi swing into action after positive test in Taranaki
node.description: A quarter of Eltham's population has been tested for Covid-19 since a case of the virus in the town was announced on Saturday evening.

node.title: Ongoing red light restrictions 'devastating' for Northland businesses
node.description: An event organiser in the region says the government decision is a blow after so much hard work by local organisations to increase vaccination rates. Audio

node.title: Crying for help: 'It feels like no one is listening'
node.description: It took four referrals and a confession she was harming herself for Quinn to finally be accepted to a DHB mental health service. But although she is now in the system, the 14 year old is still not…

node.title: House January 6 committee to vote on contempt charges against Mark Meadows
node.description: The former Trump chief of staff initially was "engaging" with the committee but has since pulled involvement.

node.title: Vicente Fernández, el rey de los machos y el desamor
node.description: Puede que el machismo encarnado por sus canciones se haya desgastado, pero su música seguirá siendo parte de las fibras sonoras de lo latinoamericano y lo latino en Estados Unidos.
